author: Ben Otto
title: Presidential Rematch Looms in Indonesia
text:
JAKARTA, Indonesia—Former general Prabowo Subianto declared his intention Wednesday to run against Indonesian President Joko Widodo—in a rematch of their contest four years ago—on a ticket that could be strengthened by the support of Indonesia’s increasingly powerful Islamic conservatives.

Mr. Subianto leads the largest opposition party in the world’s largest Muslim-majority nation, where religious conservatives are seeking to bring an Islamic agenda to the fore and are pushing lawmakers to consider banning sex outside marriage,...
